info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of gusty showers will impact portions of southwestern Pocahontas, southeastern Nicholas, northeastern Raleigh, southwestern Webster and southeastern Fayette Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 629 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of gusty showers, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Richwood, Rainelle, Marlinton, Babcock State Park, Mabscott, Shady Spring, Beaver, Daniels, Piney View, Stanaford, Prosperity, Macarthur, Craigsville, Bradley, Meadow Bridge, Hillsboro, Cranberry Mountain Nature Center, Upper Glade and Nettie. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike near mile marker 35, near mile marker 37, and between mile markers 44 and 46. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 122 and 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
